name: Teleo
headline: Supervised Autonomous Heavy Equipment
description: Teleo converts heavy equipment, like dozers, trucks, and loaders, into supervised autonomous robots. This enables a single operator to remotely operate multiple machines while sitting at a remote control center, unlocking productivity gains for the General Contractor.

founders.name: Vinay Shet, Founder
founders.description: Vinay is the co-founder and CEO of Teleo. Prior to Teleo, he was the Director of Product Management at Lyft working on building Lyft's self-driving cars. Prior to Lyft, Vinay led Product Management at Google Street View, Google Maps, and Google reCAPTCHA launching several consumer products used by millions of users worldwide. Vinay has a Ph.D. in Computer Science, focusing on Computer Vision from the University of Maryland, College Park

# SupervisedAutonomyForHeavyMachinery
[Outfit Your Equipment Today](http://www.teleo.ai/</contact/> "Outfit Your Equipment Today")
### We’rerevolutionizingheavyequipmentoperationsbyturninganypieceofequipmentintoasupervisedautonomousmachine—resultingingreaterproductivitythaneverbefore.
##### Teleo's Full Stack Solution
RobustMesh NetworkUniversalRetrofit KitRemoteCommand CenterProprietarySoftware
## Howwechangethegame
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F03%2FTeichertdozerlandscape-2-1.jpg&w=3840&q=75)
###### Increase site productivity
With one operator supervising several machines, your fleet does more work with the same number of people — boosting your bottom line. 
###### Attract more operators
Teleo’s remote command center offers significantly safer and more comfortable working conditions. Build a stronger workforce by improving the operator experience and offering a more accessible job.
###### Enhance operational visibility
We offer unprecedented analytics through real-time video and historical data. Improve operational performance by making more informed business decisions.
Real stories, real results
## FromNorthAmericatoEuropeandallthewaytoAustralia,customersusingTeleo’stechnologyaretrailblazerswithmoderninsights.
1—3
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F05%2FTim-Houchens-Head-Shot-1.jpg&w=3840&q=75)
Teleo expands what is possible related to operator environments, safety, efficiency, and supervised autonomy for our customers and the challenges they face. 
**Tim Houchens**
Dobbs Positioning Solutions
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F02%2FScott-Lyons.jpg&w=3840&q=75)
Teleo’s technology has the potential to completely transform our operations. With Teleo, two of our dump trucks that have been idle will be put back into service to haul dirt across the site autonomously, allowing our remote operators to do more. This will help us to run a more efficient operation.
**Scott Lyons**
Tomahawk Construction
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F02%2FRyan-Aarts.jpg&w=3840&q=75)
With Teleo, you have the opportunity to put operators in a much safer, secure environment. It really opens up the doors for what kinds of people can participate in our industry.
**Ryan Aarts**
John Aarts Group
Click here to play the full version of the video
## WHATTHEY’RESAYING
1—6
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F02%2Fm1.png&w=3840&q=75)
Teleo co-founder and CEO Vinay Shet discusses the potential impact of artificial intelligence on manufacturing and construction jobs on Fox Business's 'The Claman Countdown.'
[Read Article](http://www.teleo.ai/<https:/www.foxbusiness.com/video/6323671008112#sp=show-clips> "Read Article")
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F02%2Fequipment-world.png&w=3840&q=75)
Startup tech company Teleo has developed a way to retrofit heavy construction equipment so it can be operated by remote control. With it, operators can run their dozers, loaders and trucks with joysticks and monitors from anywhere.
[Read Article](http://www.teleo.ai/<https:/www.equipmentworld.com/the-dirt/video/15352360/video-teleo-ceo-on-retrofitting-equipment-for-remote-control> "Read Article")
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F02%2Fequipment-journal.png&w=3840&q=75)
Teleo is blending machine learning with the skills of human operators to help the construction industry navigate labor shortages. When installed on heavy equipment, the company's new system, Teleo Supervised Autonomy, creates a remote-controlled and semi-autonomous machine.
[Read Article](http://www.teleo.ai/<https:/www.equipmentjournal.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/4_March-20_2023.pdf> "Read Article")
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F03%2Fequipment-guide1.png&w=3840&q=75)
Teleo has completed deals with John Aarts Group, Teichert, and Tomahawk Construction and started to expand globally through a new dealer partner network with Dobbs Positioning Solutions, RDO Equipment Co., SMS Equipment Inc., and SR-O Technology.
[Read Article](http://www.teleo.ai/<https:/www.heavyequipmentguide.ca/article/39961/video-teleo-brings-remote-operation-capabilities-to-three-construction-partners> "Read Article")
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F02%2Fbay-area.png&w=3840&q=75)
Teleo wins a Bay Area Inno Award as one of nine Bay Area startups poised to change the world.
[Read Article](http://www.teleo.ai/<https:/www.bizjournals.com/sanfrancisco/inno/stories/awards/2022/09/02/teleo-remote-operation-heavy-machines.html?b=1662058211%5E22130039> "Read Article")
![](http://www.teleo.ai/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteleo2024.wpenginepowered.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F02%2FJohn-deer.png&w=3840&q=75)
John Deere has added four companies to its 2021 Startup Collaborator program, including Teleo. The Startup Collaborator program helps John Deere deepen its interaction with startup companies whose technology could add value for John Deere customers in the future.
[Read Article](http://www.teleo.ai/<https:/www.constructiondive.com/news/teleo-among-deeres-2021-startup-collaborator-program/595220/> "Read Article")

generated_description:
**Teleo: Revolutionizing Heavy Equipment Operations**

Teleo is a pioneering company founded in 2019, nestled in Palo Alto and part of Y Combinator's W20 batch. Their mission is simple yet ambitious: to transform heavy equipment—think dozers, trucks, and loaders—into supervised autonomous machines. This innovation allows a single operator to manage multiple machines from a remote control center, opening the door to breathtaking productivity gains for general contractors. 

Why does this matter? The construction industry has long struggled with labor shortages and safety concerns. Teleo's approach not only modernizes operations but also enhances the overall working environment. Their remote command center offers safer, more comfortable conditions for operators, ultimately making these jobs more appealing and accessible.

**The Full Stack Solution**
Teleo offers a holistic platform, which features:
- A **Robust Mesh Network** for seamless connectivity.
- A **Universal Retrofit Kit** that facilitates adaptation of existing heavy equipment.
- A **Remote Command Center**, enabling operators to work from a secure location.
- **Proprietary Software** to manage and analyze operations effectively.

The results speak for themselves: companies using Teleo’s technology report significant boosts in productivity as one operator can now efficiently supervise several machines instead of one. There's also increased operational visibility thanks to real-time data analytics, which empower better decision-making.

**Client Testimonials**
Teleo is already making waves globally, with success stories from North America to Europe and even Australia. Clients like Scott Lyons from Tomahawk Construction highlight that Teleo’s technology can get idle equipment back into action, ultimately running a more efficient operation. Meanwhile, Ryan Aarts from John Aarts Group underscores the importance of safety, noting that a more secure setup allows a wider range of people to participate in the industry.

**Growing Recognition**
Success has not gone unnoticed. Teleo has made headlines for its innovative approaches, with features on Fox Business and Equipment World, and has garnered accolades like the Bay Area Inno Award for being one of the nine startups poised to change the world.

In a nutshell, Teleo is not just about enhancing construction efficiency; it’s about rethinking how heavy machinery is operated in a safer, smarter, and more productive way. As they increasingly embed their solutions into the very fabric of construction operations, they stand to disrupt an industry that has remained largely unchanged for decades.

To learn more, check out their [website](http://www.teleo.ai) and see how they're driving change in the heavy equipment landscape.
